Name: Abhishek Tiwari
College: Jagran College of Arts Science and Commerce
Heading: Average college
Review:
Annual fests and sports events are organised in this college on regular basis as well as in sports this college give tough competition to other colleges, especially in cricket.
The library is available in the college on the 3rd floor and you can issue the books by showing you the I'd card and mentioning details in the register.
As I rarely go to college I wasn't a part of any group clubs although you can have details about the same in the college prospectus and official site.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: A out view of inner SRKR college
Review: Life at our campus will be very memorable and one can pack a lot of memories by the end of the course. The Annual day will be celebrated for all the college at a time and also it's so enjoyable. We do have an annual fest in the month of February and March. We do have a big central library and also departmental libraries in their own department block. One can have and show off their talent in sports, art and cultural and a lot more events and also can enjoy every moment. For each department, there will be a special executive body members team who organised all the events of their department. The ACE is for our CSE branch.

Name: Prayash kumar
Heading: NIMS
Review: I chose this course because I wanted to learn about the internet in depth. There is a total of 10 teachers for 150 students. The teachers are well highly qualified and knowledgeable. Their teaching technique is also very good. Exams are taken the time and there isn't any difficulty in passing if you have studied well.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: MDI Gurgaon - where Change Masters & Thought Leaders are nurtured
Review:
Several fests are conducted throughout the year at MDI Gurgaon -
Imperium (Flagship event & annual cultural fest held in Feb)
Illumina
Delphique
National Alumni Meet
FinConclave
HR Conclave
Nation of Innovation (Startup pitch event, graced by angel investors and VCs)
and many more

Name: Abhinav Sharma
College: Meerut Institute of Engineering and Technology - [MIET]
Heading: Meerut Institute of Engineering and Technology overall review
Review: The social life at miet is quite good. There are lots of fests that occur at the campus the main annual fest is kolahal which occurs in the month of October or November it is a 3-day fest. There are various other fests including tech fest and others. There are approximately 3 to 4 libraries on campus that provide a wide range of books for every subject including journals. The college also promotes sports and extracurricular activities. The college selected player's through trials every year for various sports and they get a chance to play in inter-college tournaments and the yearly AKTU sports fest. There are various social groups and clubs also like the robotics club satellite club and many more interesting ones furthermore there is an innovation cell in the college where a student can share his or her idea and the members help him or her with that.

Name: Tanya Gupta
Heading: IMS
Review:
I Choose The Course Because According To My Research, I Find This Course Best For Me And College Also Provides the Best Placement For It.
College Provides The Best Faculty For Finance Whereas At Every 10 Students 1Mentor Is Being As Mentor Is Liable For Their Mentee'S Growth And Career Guidance. Name: Shivam Kumar Singh
Heading: Excellent
Review: At the start of the 5th semester, you will be able to sheet in campus placement. And minimum package is 8lakh per annum and the highest package is 48lakh per annum. Many companies are coming to take students for placement like this Microsoft, Infosys, TCS, etc.

faculty are very highly qualified and highly intellectuals all over India their teaching is also very extreme soo good

Name: Aakriti Pathania
Heading: My FORE experience
Review: I am currently pursuing PGDM (Big Data Analytics). Since FSM offers dual specialisation, I opted for this course with marketing as my second specialisation. The faculty is highly qualified and they give their best to ensure that the students are familiar with all the required concepts. The course curriculum is also good, it includes all the concepts of widely used topics. Moreover, we have exams after every 1.5 months. FSM has trimesters, so in one term there is a mid-term and one end-term for each trimester.

Name: Gayathri
Heading: Let me share
Review: As I'm interested in technology I had choosen this field. Well-qualified faculty. For each semester's end exams, we have 5 to 6 months of time. It was not that difficult to pass. If we follow the classes we can pass easily. The academic calendar was prepared at per student convenience.

Name: Parth Sethi
Heading: Why to enroll for Computer science at Chitkara university
Review: I choose this course because I liked it and also I have planned for this course long before joining the university. Also, the faculty is pretty good that always tries to make things normal and easy for the students. the faculty-student ratio is somehow high here as the course is opted by a lot of students but it quite manages out without any certain or problematic situation. The faculty is pretty experienced and very good at its job . I guess almost every student quite like the way they are teaching. Exams are held regularly, for times I thought every week has an exam. University takes 20-30 exams every semester excluding practicals, viva, etc. the difficulty levels vary from exam to exam for example- End term exams are more difficult than monthly-based exams, etc but overall if you are studying regularly it's quite easy to pass all subjects. Extra classes or doubt sessions are also held after the completion of the syllabus to ensure students get the proper knowledge to score higher.

Name: Enugu srinija
Heading: My experience about my college
Review: The college fee is 96000 in that we will pay 61000 for college and 9000 for JNTU  more than that 1800 for the semester fee. The remaining 35000 College fees will be paid by the government as a scholarship. The campus placement provides placements for a maximum of the students who are with no backlogs. The average package of placement is 500000.

Name: Mohammed Zakir Hussain
Heading: Geniune Review
Review: Yuvatarang is conducted every year as an annual fest the tech fests are conducted for every 6 months the events related to particular departments are conducted every month. The Library is packed with Full of Informative and Knowledge gaining books.Every classroom is digitalized with projectors and Computers.Everyday the sport's period is given from 3 to 5 all the students are encouraged to involve in extra curricular activities like Participation in District and State level for sport events like Kho-Kho,Kabaddi, Throwball, Volleyball Cricket for both boys and girls.Many Groups are there like Google Developer Club Codechef Club which are been runned by the students

Name: Sonali
Heading: NICE COLLEGE
Review: Btech curriculum is a 4-year undergraduate program in engineering, typically covering subjects such as mathematics, Physics, chemistry, computer science, and electrical engineering. The coursework is designed to provide students with a comprehensive education in these fields, allowing them to develop the skills and knowledge necessary to become a successful engineers.

Name: Manoj
Heading: Good
Review: Because we can go to either software or hardware by choosing ECE. By having more than 6 CGPA we can apply for some companies and by maintaining more than 7 CGPA we can attend to all companies. By carrying 2 backlogs also we can attend to some companies.

Name: Karthik Reddy
Heading: College info
Review: The course curriculum was so good than any other branches in our college. They allow us to choose our open electives from the second year onwards which was so helpful for the students for learning the other branch subjects being in the original branch. Faculty members are so friendly with us that they treat us like their children and compared with the other branches we EEE branch went for the industrial visit from our college which helped us to gain practical knowledge from that visit. On that tour, our faculty members are so friendly with us that they enjoyed with us the industrial tour more. In our college faculty,: the student ratio is 1:25. Qualification of the faculty is also up to Ph.D. Level and their teaching method are also very good like they use the projector for easy understanding of the subjects and to get practical knowledge. For every 6 months, we have the semester exam in which each semester we have 2 mid-exams. each mid will have around 20 marks and the semester exam marks is upto 70.

Name: Moksh Kalra
College: Lady Shri Ram College for Women - [LSR]
Heading: 2 MONTHS AT LSR
Review: Since NEP-2020 policy is applicable to us, I would go through the Research which will be offered to us in the fourth year after completing graduation. Placement cell is active in the college as it provides various internships and placements of different sectors to the students studying in any year. Virtual, part time or full time internships and jobs are there. Full time is generally do-able in the months of May and June(in semester break). Mainly jobs are from private or corporate sector. One should take care of the attendance criteria also before applying to the internship in which they are wishing to join. University or college won't entertain any such thing. Internship policy covering every aspect is provided by the college. Students in humanities courses have relatively more chances of getting job opportunities in comparison to commerce and science stream.

Name: Manasi R Mokashi
Heading: IMT Ghaziabad - the best of MBA life
Review:
IMT is known for its finance faculty. We have great professors like Prof. Harsimran Sandhu and Prof. Arit Chaudhary who bring out the best in the students . 
I have been very lucky to be exposed to professors who have been a delight to study under. The professors are industry professionals from companies like HSBC, Zydus, Standard Chartered, HUL . 
Most of our professors are PhDs and those who aren't are from the Industry. 
There are 6 terms. It is not hard to pass but needs a lot of hard work. I got more than 9 GPA in the 1st term but I had to pull all-nighters. It depends on the person and what they prioritize. People who are very active in their clubs also get great jobs and can get better packages than high rankers. It all depends on how we carry ourselves and how much we wish to learn. IMT helps you grow as an Individual.

Name: PIYUSH VERMA
Heading: Wholesome Life at FORE
Review:
This course offered me a variety of electives from every domain including HR, Finance, Marketing, IT, Operations etc. I could opt to get the basic knowledge about each domain and also, it gives you an opportunity to explore my interests in the domain in which I want to have a career in.
The faculty-student ratio is around 1:10 including around 35-40 faculties for a batch size of 400.
Most of the faculties are highly qualified in their domain and PHD holders with a significant amount of experience. The faculties used a methodical and practical approach to teach the electives which could help students understand and grasp the concept easily and are always supportive and approachable in case the student has any doubts.
The curriculum was set up with 6 terms (around 3 months for each term). In each term, the student needs to appear for Midterm and End term exams for full-credit courses and End term for a half-credit course.

Name: G Sai Nikhil
College: BML Munjal University, School of Engineering And Technology - [SOET]
Heading: A best review for a best university
Review:
There are a total of 2 types of internships we need to do. 
1st is going to happen after 2nd year which is of 2 months.
And 2nd is going to happen between 3rd and 4th years which is of 6 months. We can pick the company we need to do work for the internship.

there will be more opportunities in electronics and communication engineering.
there will 2:60 ration in the college.
the qualification of the teachers are Ph.D. and the research in there core side and the projects are well done by them.
the exams will be more difficult than the other institutions and it is tough to pass in the subjects.

Name: Aditya Singh Shrinet
College: Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya University - [IET -DAVV]
Heading: IET DAVV 2022
Review: IET DAVV conducts central India's biggest fest named AAKSHANK and it happens around March. You'll be able to get each book from your course from the college library and you can even avail of e-books online. The college has an inter-branch sports competition conducted by the ISC sports club in the month of December/January. The college has many other clubs like the entrepreneurship club, engineers without Borders, NCC, NSS, phoenix gaming club and many more. The campus life is pretty good if you're able to adjust yourself and find your type of people.

Name: Chaitanya Kumar
College: Anil Neerukonda Institute of Technology & Sciences - [ANITS]
Heading: Good To Join
Review:
Placement starts in the third year second semester. We get trained by outside companies to shape up for the exam but we're charged extra for placements. The highest Package is from Amazon offering 20lacs pa for the role of SDE & AWS. but the intake of students is 10 from the whole college. Many students are placed in companies like TCS having an average salary of 3.5lacs pa. Around 40% of students are placed last year. I'm planning to study abroad after graduation.
As I'm interested in programming I've chosen this course. The faculty-student ratio is 1:25. Faculty members are not at all experienced in teaching us the subjects. They don't have that knowledge or experience of the curriculum. Most of the faculty members are comfortable in only one domain and when asked to teach other subjects they're no good at all. While some of them just show all the contents through slides using PPT and get over it. There's an end-semester exam for every 5 months divided into 2 semesters.

Name: Barath kumar
College: KG Reddy College of Engineering and Technology - [KGRCET]
Heading: i had great experience till now nd i'm sure it would be great journey
Review: Excellent on-campus life sports are this school's best feature because of the diversity of its pupils, who come from many places and colleges to participate in tournaments on our campus. If you communicate with them, you might learn more about society. All cultural events are under the direction of the department in charge of student welfare(clubs like literary, came for events, cie for providing guidance in entrepreneurship and etc). There are over many CCTV cameras and security guards on duty. the library where we can get different books regarding subjects, languages, and journals.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: A Good College For Teachers Education Program With High On Placement
Review:
I was passionate about teaching mathematics at the TGT level and wanted to pursue a teacher's education program.
So, I opted for BSc.BEd Course at RIE, Bhopal. It is a central institute that comes directly under NCERT.
It has a vast diversified curriculum for all round development of students.
The faculty: student ratio is 1:5.
faculty members at RIE are good and have many years of experience in the field of education. They employ various methods like GD, Project Work, Field Trips, ICT, etc.
The difficulty level of exams is moderate as it differs from person to person. There are 2-3 days gap in between exam.

Name: Lakshay Pandey
Heading: University is Good
Review: I have very much interest in Programming so I choose this course. All the faculties are well educated as most of them are from top iit's and nit's. The teaching is good.  1 year consists of 2 semesters and 1 semester consists of two exams one is the mid-term and the second one is end-term.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Story of RIE
Review:
The fee of this college is very less if we talk only about the college fee then it is different according to the category but for obc or general this fee is 14000 rupees and if we mix the hostel fee then this is 20000 rupees.
And the mess fee will be 2000 rupees. And talking about scholarships, the MP scholarship is available for the students of Madhya Pradesh and the NCERT scholarship is available for students of other states.

Name: Sai Shankar
College: International Institute of Information Technology - [IIIT] Naya Raipur
Heading: Life at IIIT NAYA RAIPUR
Review:
The campus life is quite good, our college has almost everything that is required for Engineering students. We have one of the biggest techno-cultural fests in India named Technovate it will be held for three days. We have cultural events almost every month. We have a good library facility
which will be open till 9 pm and we even have E-Library. We have full Wi-Fi in the ed Academic block and hostels were provided with ethernet so don't forget to bring ethernet cables. We have an annual sports meet named Aarambh. We have various technical(AIML, Cipercell, Comet Tsoc, E-cell, etc) and cultural clubs(Igniters, Capriccio, Take-the-bait, etc). We have almost all the sports facilities(TT, football, Badminton, Cricket, Volleyball, Basketball, etc).

Name: Jayash kale
Heading: Internship
Review: The jnvs and kvs are given opportunities to the college students in the 7th semester and these internships are added to the curriculum of the Rie. The mini project is also there for the students. these projects were also added to the curriculum.

Name: Aman Agarwal
Heading: THE COMPLETE EXPERIENCE AT FSM
Review: I chose to do PGDM ib because I have a keen interest in international affairs moreover it gives you the opportunity to grow your career and get placed abroad the faculties are great they provide deep knowledge about the subjects and keep you busy with assignments and strict deadlines where you learn how to work under pressure a student has to complete 60 credits in the first year out of which 54 credits are from core courses and 6 from electives exams are held twice every trimester there is no gap between the exams mostly two exams are held in one day but the difficulty and marking are relatively easy.

Name: Jagmohan
Heading: Satyawati Review
Review: Annual fests are held in Feb and the Last of Jan and ncc fest is also held in March. Books and journals of the whole syllabus are available in our college library and it's good. Classes have everything in good shape and sports is good for our college with sports like basketball football cricket etc and events like dance music debate are also held. Societies are there like enactus cdf etc

Name: Mandeep
Heading: CGC Internals
Review: Parivartan is the biggest fest organized in the campus which goes for 2 days. Famous singers give performances and students enjoys. Apart from this,there is an event from different courses at every day. There is central library in ECE block-1. There are many books and journals available for every courses. There are about 15000-16000 books for specific Branches. Also, students can surf through the digital library as well. There is also an annual sports meet organized within the campus. There are many clubs run by students like Electronics Project Club, Google Developer Club,etc.

Name: Vinay Verma
College: IIT Roorkee - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITR]
Heading: IIT ROORKEE review
Review:
Annual Cultural Fest- Thomso ( conducted in October)
Annual Technical Fest- Cognizance (conducted in march)
There is MGCL (Mahatma Gandhi Central Library) which has 3 stories and one underground floor which has many books and journals. There are many monitors also and best in class internet facility so you can read online also.
Classrooms have 4 AC in one room and many fans, a projector, a smartboard, a blackboard, and sofa seats and benches.
There is almost every sport available on campus be it cricket, hockey, badminton, football, volleyball, swimming, basketball, squash, or athletics. Every sport has its own court/ground.
Besides these all outdoor games, almost all indoor games are available like pool, carrom, chess, foosball, and table tennis.
Extracurricular activities include sports, gymkhana, and participating in many clubs.
There are many clubs in campus. Software group, finance group, choreo group, robotics group, poetic group, and many more.

Name: PRAMIT NATH
Heading: Wholesome Experience!
Review: Life at the campus is rigorous and fun. The campus hosts corporate leaders from various companies across different sectors as a part of their Leadership Talks. Apart from these, there are a total of 19 committees that provide ample opportunities to participate, showcase one's talent, and live a life full of energy and excitement.

Name: Soumyansu Satabdi Das
Heading: A glance into XIMB
Review:
The annual Fest in our College is Expressions, which is Eastern India's largest fest with a footfall of 30-40K within a span of 3 days. It is generally in November or January.
The library is well stocked with journals and relevant books across verticals adequately and is also stocked with magazines.
Sports and extra curricular activities happening all around the year are conducted by different committees.
They are a total of 20 committees in the college, the students can select any of them according to their interests following interviews they'll be selected for them.

Name: Jayshree Das
College: IIT BHU - Indian Institute of Technology
Heading: Kbow about IIT BHU
Review:
There are 3big fest are organized in our institute "Kashiyatra" is the cultural fest of IIT BHU  conducted in the month of January and "Technex" is the technical fest conducted in the month of March. Many celebrities are invited to perform and guests for think talk in both fest. There is also one Sports fest "Spardha" conducted in the month of October. 
About books and resources, we have a library which has a lot of books, journals,  magazines and also an AC study hall.
There are many clubs and councils in our institute. Students choose according to their interests and continue for years.  Council related to photography, drama, Art, Astrology, Quiz, Sports, Modeling, Music, Dance everything is there. 
Apart from this, there is a social service council that has some clubs under it. Also, our students teach some poor students and celebrate every festival with them through "Gyan Udyaan" and "Sahyog club" and also donate old books for those needy students.

Name: Aastha Arora
Heading: Good
Review: Summer PLacements are not good. For final placement, good companies visit campus. Mostly there are marketing companies.  Also, the strength for the whole batch is around 350-380. The average package offered is around 12-13, with a minimum cap of 8 lakh/annum.

Name: Rahul daga
Heading: Nice college
Review:
It has two parts of internals first and the second which are organized by 2 months gap and it is great for practicing for students There are 16 colleges in the university and every college has its own library where all the field-related books and latest newspapers and magazines are available. There are completely organized classrooms all have sufficient seat projector boards fans and ACs. The campus has all the sports on separate grounds where there are too many sports competitions and festivals held to motivate students.
There is a group of Management colleges which are responsible for every event management and there is a social group of engineering colleges that are making a web series.

Name: Ananya Bhartiya
Heading: Life at Lloyd School of Law
Review:
There are many societies in the college like moot court society, ADR center, research and writing center, debate society, trial advocacy, your lordship (for judiciary), cultural cell, etc.
The annual cultural fest is known as Catalyst which is conducted in March.
The library is well equipped with books. The reading room is also there.
The college has an e-subscription to SCC online, Hein online and another database.
The college has football ground, basketball ground, badminton court, indoor games etc.
The college has its official account in facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn.

College: G L Bajaj Institute of Technology and Management
Heading: A good college to be considered during counseling.

The companies start to provide placements during the 7th semester till the end of the 8th semester. There are various companies which visit the campus every year like amazon, palo alto, paytm, junglee games etc. Every year the placement record is increasing drastically.

College: IIT Mandi- Indian Institute of Technology - [IITM]
Heading: Go for it

IIT Mandi is known for its strong curriculum and dedicated faculty members. The institute offers undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral programs in various fields of engineering, science, and humanities. The curriculum is designed to provide students with a strong foundation in the relevant subject matter, as well as hands-on experience through lab work, projects, and internships.

Name: SOUMYA JHA
Heading: Making it worth every minute of the half college life we got.
Review: I was a commerce student in school and I decided to opt for BBA because this field interests me. My course commenced in December 2020. As my college used to run online mode due to the pandemic, I had a little bit of difficulty adjusting to the mode. But while being in online mode, all important notes and study material were provided to us by our teachers. They also used to try to make the classes more interesting through presentations and activities. 3 initial semesters out of the 6 were spent via online mode. Then, the Government permitted universities to reopen colleges which was a very happy moment because the offline mode of education teaches much more than just academics. On 14th February 2022, we attended college for the first time in our 4th semester. The faculty was helpful and lenient as students were trying to adjust to the offline mode yet again. The teaching method used by the faculty was perfectly paced and explanatory. Regular class tests were taken. Exams were regular.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: NIT KKR honest review
Review:
I was getting only this course at my rank 
The student-faculty ratio is about 1:8, you can find so many phD Holders taking tutorials classes formally but they don't even come to class not even for attendance.
All the faculties here are PhD holders and one of the best in their field and most of them have done PhD from REC Kurukshetra (NIT KKR) Itself, especially the old ones. Their teaching method is not so modern but very classy, they just stick to the syllabus and not to the industrial exposure also they didn't give any attention whether you are studying or playing Games in class they just need your attendance otherwise they will detain you.
Term exams are held on a uniform basis every month we can say. As there is a semester of 4-5 months, you have to give 2 Mid-semester exams and One end sem exam and the overall CGPA depends on both of these scores. You can easily pass the exam but for scoring well you have to study really hard coz they didn't give you marks but will pass easily.

The college caters to all the sports needs of the students by providing them with all the necessary courts and grounds for all sports. The campus even has a swimming pool with a jacuzzi.

Name: Aman

College: Indian Institute of Management Trichy IIM
Heading: IIM Trichy

Name: DONTAMSETTI SATYA SAI KRISHNA
College: IIM Bangalore - Indian Institute of Management
Heading: All about IIM B
Review: The course was holistic covering all facets of business, not sticking to general MBA courses, some courses like business ethics, and governance was included to get a broad perspective. electives in the first year are a good plus and there is no restriction on specialization. I can choose courses I wish in the second year, I can take a few from marketing few from finance, a few from analytics, and a few from public policy. we have a healthy student-to-faculty ratio and the quality of the faculty is top-notch. teaching methodology depends on the course, for some courses we have case-based learning which enhances our thinking perspective rather than having theory. exams happen every 5 weeks, though subjects are relatively easy compared with UG, question papers and the peer group make your life difficult.

Name: MAMTA BARUAH
College: IIM Raipur Indian Institute of Management
Heading: Insider Insights: A Student's Review of IIM Raipur
Review:
Life at the Campus of IIM can be quite hectic due to the rigorous academic schedule, however, the institute provides a holistic environment for the students to grow both professionally and personally.
The annual cultural fest is called "Karmaanta". The dates of these fests vary depending on the institute but they are usually conducted in the months of February-March.
The libraries are well equipped with books, journals, and other study materials required for the students and also can access to digital resources and online databases.
The classrooms are equipped with modern amenities such as projectors and sound systems to facilitate better learning. The institute also provides computer labs, sports facilities, and other recreational spaces for the students.
There are numerous clubs and societies that students can join based on their interests. These clubs conduct various events and activities throughout the year. For example, there are clubs for Marketing, Finance, Operations, etc.

Name: Piyush
Heading: Rec Abn Info
Review: There is one professor for every five students at this college, which I believe is a good faculty-to-student ratio. Information technology is the best area of study at this institution, and I am interested in computers, coding, and software development. We have two midterm exams and a final exam; if you attend all of the classes, the exam will be simple for you; if not, it will be challenging, in my opinion. If you start studying a month before the exam, you will be able to pass the final exam with ease and earn good grades.

Name: Ayan Ahmed Hashmi
College: Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology  - [MANIT]
Heading: MANIT: A college worth considering if you like a challenge
Review: My course is Bachelor of Technology in Electronics and Communication. I opted for this course as I liked the software field but I also had a keen interest in the electrical spectrum of technology. All the professors are ph.d and there are 20+ professors in the ECE department of MANIT along with ph.d scholars to assist them and also college supporting staff. As the current strength of my batch is about 160 and 20+ the strength of our faculty is 8:1, faculty: student ratio which in my opinion is quite impressive. Term exams are performed at the end of each semester total semesters being 8 with midterms being conducted in the middle of each term. The exams are quite challenging and scoring being CGPA format all depends on outperforming your batchmates. But still, if you put even some notable effort into exams you are not going to flunk and pass with nearly flying colors.

Name: NIKHIL SURESH
College: IIM Bangalore - Indian Institute of Management
Heading: The place to be
Review:
The fees structure at IIM Bangalore is divided into two categories. The first category is for Indian Students and the second category is for International Students.
For Indian Students:
The fee for the two-year Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP) is Rs. 22.17 lakhs. This includes tuition fees, hostel fees (optional), mess charges, and other applicable fees.
for International Students:
The fee for the two-year Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP) is US$60,000. This includes tuition fees, hostel fees (optional), mess charges, and other applicable fees.
Financial Assistance:
IIM Bangalore also offers a number of financial assistance schemes to its students. These include an Interest-free Education Loan Scheme, an Education Loan Scheme with Collateral, a Student Loan Scheme, an Education Loan Scheme for Economically Weaker Sections, and an Education Loan Scheme for International students

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Honest review on IIM Bodh Gaya
Review: Almost all of the students get jobs on campus through placements. For our batch 2021-23 the fee was 13 Lakhs whereas the average package for our batch is 16 Lakhs. There are very few guys (1-2%) who opt-out for their own start-ups, family businesses, or any other personal issues. All of the students get mentorship and placement assistance through professors for every domain. This year 50% of the offers are made by banks and financial sectors. Top recruiters were ICICI Bank, ICICI Securities, HDFC Bank, BNY Mellon, and IDBI Bank. Kotak Mahindra Bank, SBI Capital, Delloitte US, Reliance retail, Vovo-Eicher, Hindalco, Amazon and many more. One of the luckiest guys in the batch got a 48.5 LPA package and was offered the role of Chief Operations Officer. The average package for the top 10% batch was above 24 Lakhs. Whereas the top 25% and 50% batches got an average package of 21.81 Lakhs and 18.79 Lakhs respectively. Also, the top 75% of the batch got a package of 17+ lakhs.

Name: Tajamul Islam
Heading: TJ review

Teachers here are qualified, and they used to teach from books. Teachers are helpful and knowledgeable. They guide and help students in every possible way. Exams are conducted on time. Mid-semester exams are a bit poor, but end-semester exams are quite vigorous. There is a need for proper dedication, especially in the maths department.

Name: Aayushi Vats
Heading: Old world charm clubbed with nostalgia - an ode to my alma mater
Review: The infrastructure at the campus is antiquated but maintained, giving off an old-world charm. The campus is beautiful and full of serene natural beauty and spaciousness, being the largest residential University campus in Asia. The Central Library was recently awarded the best campus library in India, so, needless to say, there is no dearth of quality academic resources. Libraries at the faculty and department level are also well-stocked. Various faculties and departments conduct their own fests, so the campus is always buzzing with activities. There are all kinds of student-run clubs, and steller sports facilities (there's even an airstrip for the aviation club).

Core courses in various functional areas of management such as marketing, finance, operations, and strategy
Elective courses in specialized areas such as entrepreneurship, supply chain management, and digital business
Case studies, simulations, and project work to provide hands-on experience in problem-solving and decision-making
Workshops, guest lectures, and industrial visits provide exposure to real-world business problems and practices
Dissertation or research project to apply knowledge and skills acquired during the program to a specific business problem or area of interest.

Name: KAMROOP KUMAR IYER
Heading: The journey through Planet-I
Review:

Subjects such as Competency Frameworks, Talent Acquisition, Performance Management, Compensation & Benchmarking, HR Analytics, etc. are taught to us by a few of the best faculty in the country.
All the faculty here are PhDs from one of the top 6 IIMs of the country and are excellent in their knowledge as well as teaching. The method used here is a discussion with a combination of presentations, cases, and another plethora of methods that are beneficial for the students. The faculty: student ratio is around 1:12.
Exams are conducted for each term promptly, with in-class quizzes depending on the professor. The questions in the examinations are usually learning and application based, hence if a person has understood the concepts well, they would be able to score good marks.

Name: Kushagra

The Institute has a large number of industry partnerships and collaborations, which provide students with a wide range of internship opportunities.
The internships are usually offered in the summer, which starts in May and ends in July, but some companies also offer internships in the winter as well, which starts from December and ends in January. The duration of an internship can vary depending on the company and the specific internship program, but most internships last between 8-12 weeks.
BITS Pilani encourages students to pursue internships that align with their interests and career goals. The CDC provides students with career counseling and guidance services to help them identify and apply for internships that are a good fit for them.

Name: Shubham Kumar
College: IIT Bombay - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITB]
Heading: Inside IITB
Review: I chose this course after discussing it with my coaching teachers, a few seniors from IITs, and relatives, and also because according to my rank, the Mechanical department was the best I would have got at IIT Bombay. Also, I was quite interested in motors and the mechanics behind them. The faculty-student ratio is approximately 16-18 students per faculty which are quite decent. The minimum qualification to be a faculty at IIT Bombay is a Ph.D. Most of the faculties here are highly qualified and have taken degrees from the world's top few colleges or universities. The teaching method of the faculty is very good, slides are provided for every lecture. Tutorial problems with solutions are there for a better grasp of the concepts. There are teaching assistants for each course whom we can contact at any time for any academic queries/ issues/ doubts. There are two term exams - mid-sem and Endsem. Midsem is conducted approximately mid-way through the semester (approx. 2 months after sem starts) and end-sem at the end.

Name: Ankush Goyal
Heading: A read for the right decision for your career!
Review:
I have chosen marketing as specialization and as a degree, it is a core MBA profile. The field should be chosen exclusively based on one's interests and future opportunities. The person's career and educational background influences the chosen specialization. 
IMTG has a faculty: student ratio of about 1:40which is good in the industry with professors and experts in their fields. 
The teachers are all Ph.D. holders. The method is a case study based which helps students learn from real-life scenarios along with practical importance given to roleplay and regular assignments. 
Term exams are once in 3 months with regular assignments and PPT. One gets thorough knowledge about the subject from reading and practically applying the skill. Difficulty depends on the preparation of the student and it's easy to score in exams but the marking is relative.

Name: VARTIKA SHARMA
Heading: Overview of MBA at FORE School of Management Delhi
Review:
FORE offers dual specialization, which allows students to study their desired subjects from Term 3 onwards, as per the specialization chosen. An exhaustive course curriculum is followed here which is in sync with the other premium B-schools in India. The entire duration of the PGDM program is spread across 6 terms, in the Trimester system form. Here, each term has its internal and external evaluation, inclusive of the Mid-term and End-term examinations. 
As far as the faculty is concerned, almost all of the professors are Ph.D. holders that too from renowned institutes such as IITs, IIMs, or FMS. Other than that, for some subjects visiting faculty from other colleges like IIFT Delhi and MDI Gurgaon also teach students.  In addition to that, a series of Guest Lectures are also conducted by corporate leaders on essential management-related topics.

Name: Swasti Sahewal
Heading: IIFT a beautiful journey to success
Review: Vivaan, a techno-management event, draws 3000 visitors to IIFT in October. Twenty business leaders, fifteen academics, and thirty IIFT alumni openly describe their experiences in Vivaan. Through a library card, you get 30 days to access books and research papers. Faculty members even wrote some books. Twelve huge classrooms each have 52 wooden chairs, one desktop, one live projector, and one microphone and speaker. There are yoga classes, gyms, and an Olympia committee.
